thread.title: ‘I went topless in public and got inked’
thread.title_full: ‘I went topless in public and got inked’

title: ‘I went topless in public and got inked’
text:
Email a friend 
MORE than a third of Australians admit they’ve done something daring on holiday that they never would have done back at home in their normal environment. 
From topless paragliding to embarking on a holiday fling or eating a bamboo rat, travellers fessed up to some pretty wild acts in a new Wotif.com survey. 
According to the results, there’s just something about being somewhere different that gives us a sense of freedom. 
“Aussies are simply more daring on holidays, with one traveller sharing that they walked on a tightrope across a cavern in the Blue Mountains, and another revealing they hired a camel and explored the Sahara desert solo,” Wotif’s Kirsty La Bruniy said. 
“I remember on my own travels getting caught up in the excitement of being in Koh Tao, Thailand and impulsively doing my scuba diving certificate, when I’m usually really afraid of sharks.” 
Australians are also not afraid to be more adventurous with their food choices overseas, chomping down on a range of local delicacies. 
“Trying the local food is all part of the cultural experience and we found plenty of Aussie travellers swap their vegemite sandwiches for exotic eats like bamboo rat and bulls testicles.” 
A rather surprising result was that men were more likely to max out the credit card (31 per cent) on holidays, compared to women (28 per cent). 
And it turns out that South Australians are far more daring than the other states when on holiday (42 per cent), followed by Victorians (38 per cent). 
Meanwhile, Western Australians are quite likely to lock lips with someone on holiday (19.6 per cent), while Queenslanders take the wrap for being perhaps a bit too relaxed — with one in five wearing daggy clothes. — Jenny Michell (@MissJenMichell) April 30, 2014 
Some of the most daring things Aussies have done on holiday: 
1. Hiking into the Norwegian wilderness alone. 
2. Travelling with no money and sleeping outdoors. 
3. Tightrope walking across a cavern in the Blue Mountains. 
4. Paragliding topless in Fiji. 
5. Eating a bamboo rat. Bamboo rat on the menu. Picture: Scott Edmunds Source: 
6. Hiring a camel alone at the edge of the Sahara. 
7. Eating bulls testicles. 
8. Starting a karaoke party in a stranger’s flat with over 100 people inside. 
9. Making love in a canoe during a honeymoon. 
10. Taking part in a ‘Fear Factor Eating Comp’ in Tallinn, Estonia. Look over there! Wait ... Source: 
The most common ‘daring’ things Aussies do on holiday, and not at home: 
1. Staying up to watch the sunrise (33.2 per cent). 
2. Maxing out the credit card (28.5 per cent). 
3. Dancing until the early morning (22.3 per cent). 
4. Locking lips with a stranger (13.7 per cent). 
5. Wearing daggy clothes (15.8 per cent). 
6. Pretending to be posh (7.9 per cent). 
7. Letting my hygiene standards slip (7.7 per cent) — eww! 
8. Lying about what I do for work (7 per cent). 
9. Pretending to be someone else (5.6 per cent). 
10 Getting a tattoo (4.8 per cent). 
11. Getting a piercing (2.2 per cent). Some even get inked. Picture: Torbakhopper Source:
